class ngclearn.engine.ngc_graph.NGCGraph(K=10, name='ncn')[source]¶

Bases: object

Implements the full model structure/graph for an NGC system composed of nodes and cables.

@author: Alexander G. Ororbia

apply_constraints()[source]¶

Apply constraints to the signals embedded in this graph. 1) compute new precision matrices 2) project weights to adhere to vector norm constraints

calc_evolved_cable_updates(gamma_et=1.0, decay_et=0.0, rule_type='temp_diff', lambda_e=0.01)[source]¶

Applies a slow evolution of specific target cables/synapses via a temporal difference rule that uses information from a set of source cables/synapses

Parameters

  • gamma_et –

  • decay_et –

  • rule_type – lra, temp_diff, hybrid (i.e., lra + weighted temp_diff)

calc_updates(debug_map=None)[source]¶

Calculates the updates to synaptic weight matrices along each non-identity wire within this NCN operation graph via a generalized Hebbian learning rule (or via calculus if a wire is an attention wire).

check_correctness()[source]¶

Runs basic correctness check for this graph (examines if structure is valid)

clamp(node_name, data, is_persistent=True)[source]¶

Clamp particular values to a particular component of a specific node/cell

Parameters

  • node_name –

  • data – (component name, data value)

Returns

clear()[source]¶

Clear/delete any persistent signals in this graph

clone_state()[source]¶

Clones the entire state of this graph (in terms of signals/tensors) and stores each node’s state dictionary in global has map :return:

extract(node_name, node_var_name)[source]¶

Extract a particular signal from a particular node embedded in this graph

Parameters

  • node_name –

  • node_var_name –

Returns

getNode(node_name)[source]¶

Extract a particular node from this graph

Parameters

  • node_name –

  • node_var_name –

Returns

inject(node_name, data)[source]¶

Injects particular values to a particular component of a specific node/cell (but does not affect the persistence or other components of the cell)

Parameters

  • node_name –

  • data – (component name, data value)

Returns

set_cycle(nodes)[source]¶

Set an execution cycle in this graph

Parameters

nodes –

Returns

None

set_evolve_pair(pair)[source]¶
set_to_state(state_map)[source]¶

Set every state of every node in this graph to the values contained in the global hashap “state_map”

settle(clamped_vars=[], readout_vars=[], init_vars=[], cold_start=True, K=- 1, debug=False, masked_vars=[])[source]¶

Conduct iterative inference using the execution pathway(s) defined by this graph

class ngclearn.engine.proj_graph.ProjectionGraph(name='sampler')[source]¶

Bases: object

Implements a projection graph – useful for conducting ancestral sampling of a directed generative model or ancestral projection of a clamped graph. Note that this graph system is NOT learnable.

@author: Alexander G. Ororbia

clear()[source]¶

Clear/delete any persistent signals in this graph
